channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Salah says he has been 'thrown under the bus' by Liverpool
item.description: Mohamed Salah says he has been "thrown under the bus" at Liverpool and that his relationship with boss Arne Slot has broken down.

item.title: Liverpool surrender two-goal lead as Leeds score late to draw 3-3
item.description: Liverpool let a two goal lead slip as they draw 3-3 with Leeds after a late equaliser from Ao Tanaka.

item.title: Villa's late strike ends Arsenal's unbeaten run
item.description: Emi Buendia scores a late winner for Aston Villa as they beat Arsenal 2-1 at Villa Park and move three points behind the league leaders.

item.title: Man City beat Sunderland to narrow gap at top
item.description: Manchester City beat Sunderland 3-0 to move within two points of leaders Arsenal in the Premier League.

item.title: Simons scores first Premier League goal as Spurs beat Brentford
item.description: Thomas Frank gets a much-needed victory as Tottenham beat his former club Brentford 2-0, with Xavi Simons scoring his first Premier League goal.

item.title: Everton fire three past Forest to move into fifth
item.description: Sean Dyche's return to his former club ends in defeat as Everton beat Nottingham Forest 3-0.

item.title: Newcastle avoid late scare to beat 10-man Burnley
item.description: Bruno Guimaraes scores direct from a corner as Newcastle beat Burnley 2-1 at St. James' Park in the Premier League.

item.title: Semenyo goal ruled out as Bournemouth and Chelsea play out goalless draw
item.description: Antoine Semenyo has a goal ruled out as Bournemouth and Chelsea play out a 0-0 draw at the Vitality Stadium.

item.title: Evening World Cup kick-offs for England, but Scotland face 2am opener
item.description: England are handed World Cup kick-off times which suit UK audiences - but Scotland fans face later finishes during next summer's tournament.

item.title: 'I never saw Messi do this' - Guardiola no fan of Cherki rabona assist
item.description: Rayan Cherki's sublime assist in Manchester City's win over Sunderland on Saturday drew gasps from the home crowd and may be a moment of inspiration to turn the tide in the title race.

item.title: Are Aston Villa in title hunt - and should Arsenal start to worry?
item.description: Unai Emery continues to deny Aston Villa are in the Premier League title race but Arsenal now look vulnerable.

item.title: 'Spurs boss Frank eases pressure but tide has not turned yet'
item.description: Spurs head coach Thomas Frank sees the pressure eased with victory over Brentford - but the tide has not turned yet, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: 'He has to score, or we replace him' - Barry finally ends goal drought
item.description: The smile said it all after Thierno Barry got his first Everton goal in his 17th game for the club, and the challenge now is for him to keep scoring.

item.title: Weston-super-Mare make history and joy for two Robins - FA Cup round-up
item.description: BBC Sport reflects on the key talking points from the FA Cup second round results as non-league Weston-super-Mare go through.

item.title: Slot in disbelief after Liverpool twice squander lead against Leeds
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says they "did not deserve that result" as they twice surrendered the lead during a 3-3 draw against Leeds.

item.title: 'Messi keeps things simple' Guardiola lukewarm on Cherki's Rabona assist
item.description: Pep Guardiola urges Rayan Cherki to keep things simple following his Rabona assist during Manchester City's 3-0 win over Sunderland.

item.title: 'It feels like a win today' - Farke on Leeds thrilling draw with Liverpool
item.description: Leeds United boss Daniel Farke gives "all the credit to the players" after they secured a dramatic 3-3 draw against Liverpool.

item.title: Blackstenius scores late winner as Arsenal beat Liverpool
item.description: Stina Blackstenius scores an 87th-minute winner as Arsenal beat Liverpool 2-1 at the Emirates in the WSL.

item.title: Kane scores 10th Bundesliga hat-trick as Bayern thrash Stuttgart
item.description: Harry Kane comes off the bench to score a hat-trick as Bayern Munich win 5-0 away at Stuttgart in the Bundesliga.

item.title: 'I'm free' - Â£1m Smith provides Arsenal spark
item.description: Olivia Smith steals the show with a goalscoring display against former side Liverpool to help Arsenal climb back into the Women's Super League top three.

item.title: Brighton owner Bloom denies betting claims
item.description: Tony Bloom says he "categorically assure" fans that he has never placed bets on matches involving the team since becoming Brighton owner.

item.title: Mainoo in demand for January loan - Saturday's gossip
item.description: At least 12 clubs want Kobbie Mainoo on loan, Nottingham Forest set to increase Elliot Anderson price, Saudi clubs confident of cut-price Mohamed Salah deal, plus more.

item.title: Old and new foes - a look at England's World Cup group
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Croatia, Panama and Ghana - England's Group L opponents at the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Haaland v Mbappe, dream ties and YMCA - the best of the World Cup draw
item.description: YMCA, Donald Trump and Kylian Mbappe v Erling Haaland - BBC Sport runs through the best bits from the World Cup draw.

item.title: I want to come back to Premier League and win it this time - Pochettino
item.description: Former Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about growing up on a farm, barbecues and his future.

item.title: 'What a goal!' Great Britton volley helps fire Weston-super-Mare through
item.description: Watch as Louis Britton scores a thunderous volley for Weston-super-Mare in a 2-0 victory at Chelmsford City that sends them through to the third round of the FA Cup.

item.title: 'It was certainly due' - Moyes happy for Barry after first Everton goal
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes says Thierno Barry's first goal for the Toffees "was certainly due" after the striker scored in his side's 3-0 win over Nottingham Forest.

item.title: 'That is absolutely outstanding' Drinan scores 30-yard lob for hat-trick
item.description: Swindon Town's Aaron Drinan completes his hat-trick with an "outstanding" strike against Bolton in the FA Cup.

item.title: Spurs were big threat going forward - Frank
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur boss Thomas Frank is "happy with so many things" after a convincing 2-0 win against former club Brentford.

item.title: 'It's brilliant, it's delightful!' Ennis scores 'delicious' goal for Fleetwood
item.description: Watch as Ethan Ennis scores a "delicious" goal for Fleetwood in the FA Cup against Luton.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v DJ and producer Paige Tomlinson
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on DJ Paige Tomlinson - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Could one win get Scotland out of World Cup group?
item.description: BBC Scotland digs into Scotland's World Cup progression prospects.

item.title: Plotting England and Scotland's routes through the World Cup
item.description: It took a while, but the World Cup draw is finally done and fans of England and Scotland can start to work out their path to glory.

item.title: England start World Cup against Croatia, Scotland to face Brazil
item.description: England will begin their World Cup 2026 campaign against Croatia, while Scotland are drawn in the same group as Brazil for next summer's tournament.

item.title: End of Arsenal unbeaten run painful - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says his side's first defeat since August is "painful" but their level of consistency has been "incredible" after losing 2-1 to Aston Villa.

item.title: Emery praises Villa consistency after beating Arsenal
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery praises their consistency after a 2-1 win against Arsenal.

item.title: 'A good chance' - McFadden on Scotland's World Cup group
item.description: Former Scotland forward James McFadden joins Football Focus to react to his country's 2026 World Cup group draw.

item.title: Tuchel reacts to England's 'difficult' World Cup group
item.description: World Cup 2026: Thomas Tuchel reacts to England's 'difficult' group after draw

item.title: 'Bring it on' - Clarke reacts to Scotland's World Cup draw
item.description: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke reacts to being drawn into Group C for the 2026 World Cup alongside Brazil, Morocco and Haiti.

item.title: Who are favourites to win the 2026 World Cup?
item.description: The 2026 World Cup draw has been made which means the countdown to the tournament is on - but who are the favourites to win the coveted trophy?

item.title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
item.description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

item.title: Who are the 2026 World Cup debutants?
item.description: From a tiny Caribbean island to a nation once managed by Harry Redknapp, meet the teams who will be making their debut at the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Success in 2025 - are the Lionesses ready for 2026?
item.description: England capped off a successful 2025 with resounding victories over China and Ghana at home - so what shape are they in for World Cup qualification?

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Who is Arsenal teenager Salmon?
item.description: Arsenal add 16-year-old Marli Salmon to their squad for Saturday's Premier League game against Aston Villa at Villa Park, but who is he?

item.title: Which team won the fewest points in a Premier League season?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at which clubs amassed the lowest points tally in a single season.

item.title: What is the dubious goals committee?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the dubious goals committee is and how the identities of goal scorers are decided

item.title: Why is Son Heung-min returning to Tottenham?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why former captain Son Heung-min is returning to Tottenham.

item.title: When are Premier League players heading to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains when players will meet up with their countries at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Scotland to play World Cup games in Boston & Miami
item.description: Scotland will play their World Cup Group C games in Boston and Miami, with their opener against Haiti at Gillette Stadium starting at 02:00 BST on 14 June.

item.title: On the rise & without fear - Motherwell a force under Askou
item.description: BBC Scotland explores Motherwell's revolution under Jens Berthel Askou

item.title: How Viking ended 34-year Norwegian title drought
item.description: Viking FK wrap up their first Norwegian league title in 34 years, sparking big celebrations in the city of Stavanger. BBC Sport takes a look at their achievement.

item.title: Ajax criticise 'outrageous' fireworks after match abandoned
item.description: Ajax criticise the "utterly outrageous" firework display which resulted in their Dutch league match against Groningen being abandoned.

item.title: What's going on with fan disorder at European games?
item.description: Was the disorder of Young Boys fans at Aston Villa an isolated incident, or does it indicate something more prevalent?

item.title: Littlejohn given extended ban for violent conduct
item.description: Crystal Palace midfielder Ruesha Littlejohn has been given an extended five-match ban for violent conduct after grabbing an opponent by the neck and throwing her to the ground.

item.title: 'The time was right' - Oxtoby swaps Northern Ireland for Newcastle
item.description: Stepping away from international football to manage a club in England's second tier was a decision Tanya Oxtoby "didn't take lightly".

item.title: Arroyo proud of Kendall's 'amazing' first England goal
item.description: Aston Villa manager Natalia Arroyo says she has watched the "amazing moment" of Lucia Kendall's first England goal multiple times in recent days.

item.title: Meet the Gurkha's daughter making WSL history
item.description: Asmita Ale discusses her incredible family history, being the first person of Nepalese descent to sign a professional contract in England and play in the Women's Super League.

item.title: Man Utd will look to sign cover for pregnant Bizet
item.description: Manchester United manager Marc Skinner has said the club will look to sign cover for midfielder Celin Bizet in January after she announced her pregnancy.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
